Configuring Clients for Use with File Servers

Once you have configured the file server and created path maps, you must enter the path(s) to the server(s) using the desktop client so all Version Manager clients know where the servers are located.

Once you have saved a server configuration file, you can point each client system to it.

To configure clients for use with file servers:

  1. Launch the desktop client.

  2. Select Admin | File Servers. The File Server Configuration dialog box appears.

  3. Select a server in the File Servers list and do any of the following:

    • To reposition the selected server in the File Servers list, click the Up () or Down () arrow button. Version Manager searches starting from the top of this list.

    • To delete the selected server from the list, click the Delete () button.

    • To add a server to the list, click the Add () button. The Add File Server URL dialog box appears.

      1. Enter the name of the system hosting the server. For example, MyServer. Optionally, you may specify a port. For example, MyServer:Port. By default, port 8080 is used.

      2. Click OK.

    • To edit the URL of the selected server, click the Edit () button. The Edit File Server URL dialog box appears.

      1. Edit the URL in the Name field.

      2. Click OK.

    • To test the connection to the selected server, click the Test button.

  4. Enter a path and file name (*.ini) in which to store server configuration information in the Store server configuration information in field.

    To ease configuration for all users, setup the list of servers then place the configuration file on a network where all users can access it. Then the users need only specify the shared location of the configuration file to automatically populate their own File Servers list.

  5. Click OK.

NOTE Once a user's system is configured, the user can open a server-based project database from the desktop client by selecting File | Open Project Database and then selecting File Servers from the Look in list.

NOTE The Version Manager File Server is an option during installation. It is administered via a servlet on the server. For detailed information, see the Serena ChangeMan Version Manager Administrator's Guide or the admin servlet help.
